titleStmt.title: [Photograph of posthole patterns of Cherokee winter and summer domestic houses at the former site of the mid-18th century Cherokee town of Citico, taken in 1978] / [by Robert D. Newman]: a machine-readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Newman, Robert D.

availability.p: This work is the property of the McClung Museum, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Photograph of posthole patterns of Cherokee winter and summer domestic houses at the former site of the mid-18th century Cherokee town of Citico, taken in 1978] / [by Robert D. Newman]
bibl.author: Newman, Robert D.
bibl.note: This is a photograph of posthole patterns of mid-18th century summer and winter domestic dwellings from the Overhill Cherokee town of Citico. As was common in most Overhill villages winter houses were built in a circular dome structure which contained a central hearth for fire. Adjacent to the winter home was an open rectangular summer pavilion used in warm weather. Excavations were conducted by the University of Tennessee in 1978 in anticipation of the flooding of the lower Little Tennessee River by the Tellico Dam Reservoir. The excavations were conducted under contract with the National Park Service and the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA). Principal investigator, Jefferson Chapman. Field Director, Robert D. Newman
Frank H. McClung Museum Photographic Collection

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

figure.figDesc: Posthole pattern of Cherokee winter (circular) and summer (rectangular) domestic houses at Citico, mid-18th century. Excavations by University of Tennessee, 1978. Photograph by Robert D. Newman. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.

p.note: This document consists of one image only.
